> If it was busy in regex extraction, rather than a network fetch,

ere's probably a reproduceable problem with our regex expressions,

they perform inefficiently against challenging input.

e of the URI(s) affected, or can you find them again?

hem to me directly if you'd like.

regexes to avoid any such 
problems,
> as we've had to do a number of times=
 in the past. In addition to
> holding the thread, these kinds of problems =
also tend to monopolize 
the
> CPU, noticeably slowing the whole crawler.
